meanings.definition: Relating to a function that is both injective and surjective.
meanings.sent1: The bijective function mapped each element uniquely and covered all elements in the set.
meanings.sent2: The mathematician explained how the bijective relationship ensured no element was left out in the mapping.
meanings.sent3: The bijective function was like a perfect puzzle piece, fitting each element snugly into place.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was bijective, capturing every detail with precision and completeness.
meanings.sent5: The bijective nature of the function made it easy to visualize the one-to-one correspondence.

meanings.definition: Involving a one-to-one correspondence between two sets.
meanings.sent1: The bijective relationship between the sets ensured each element had a unique partner.
meanings.sent2: The bijective mapping showed a clear connection between every element in the two sets.
meanings.sent3: The bijective sets were like dance partners, moving in perfect sync with each other.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was bijective, with each understanding the other completely.
meanings.sent5: The bijective correspondence between the sets made it easy to establish a clear link between them.
